name: Pakistani Bokhara 2.5x4 FT Rug No. 1211
shortDescription: Bokhara Rugs are the one the most popular handmade rugs and thats why these are constantly being crafted and remain available in a wide range of sizes. name: Pakistani Baluchi 2.5x4 FT Rug No. 1211
shortDescription: Baluchi rugs (also called Baluch or Beluchi rugs) are traditional tribal handmade rugs originally made by Baloch people living near the border between Iran, Pakistan and Afghanistan. Baluchi rugs are soft, flexible and extremely resilient. These rugs are different from other rugs due to their pattern and design.

name: Beljik 2.5x4 FT Rug No. 1211
shortDescription: Beljik rugs are Afghan tribal handmade rugs. These rugs are popular for their shades of deep red, blue and black colors having geometric patterns with complex borders. These rugs are considered to be the finest of all tribal rugs. The wool to woven these rugs are taken from the belly of the sheep and it takes many sheep to make the Beljik rug.

name: Gabbeh 4x6 FT Rug No. 1211
shortDescription: Gabbeh rugs are Persian handmade rugs. In Persian Language “Gabbeh” means raw or natural. These rugs are knotted by the nomads of the Ghashghai tribe in the Fars province of Iran. These rugs are simple, elegant and considered as the most famous nomad rugs from Iran.
